caption:
. #challengeaccepted #womensupportingwomen #womensupportingwomeninbusiness  thanks to @rajkainth1 for thinking of our co-founder @ravymehroke in this #Instagramchallenge that spreads love and support to women around the globe seeking justice for what’s right.
.
We’ve researched this challenge and learned it began in Turkey after the death of Pinar Gultekin, who was murdered by her ex-boyfriend. Women began posting black and white photos of themselves due to the frustration of seeing obit photos of women (usually b&w).
.
The idea is that by posting a photo of you in b&w you are showing solidarity with them, demanding change and a voice to the voiceless. These women are your sisters. Bring them back to life by sharing their story as many men still disregard their worth and ours.
.
Instagram challenges often mutate over time, but We see the love and support for one another with this one. Even if ppl may not recognize it’s original meaning. Stand for your girlfriends and women across the globe. Include the hashtags when sharing your B&W photo:

#femicide.
#feminism.
#womenempoweringwomen.
#sisterhood.
#kadınaşiddetehayır.
#istanbulsözleşmesiyaşatır.
.
We’re so grateful to the amazing women who make up our @bombaybrowbar community. We love you from the inside out. Let’s spread more love and support to women and women-led businesses. @strippedwaxbar you’re next! Post a photo in black and white with the words Challenge Accepted, include awareness about this challenge, then pass it on to another woman-led business to do the same.💞let’s keep this going and share our support for the voiceless.
